commit_message: limit to 3 cores so can parallelise multiple runs nicely
update README with results_folder -> intermediates_folder reorg
put forceCall intermediate files in the intermediates folder
put estimate constants intermediate files in their own folder
give user full control of file names

enable arbitrary number of columns in forcecalling bedfile

so we can use the results peakfile from another sample directly
bugfix: use re-estimated beta coefficients in 2nd iteration

move fragment overlap coverage function to functions.R

so can be used by ForceCallPeaks too

specify outdir not datapath

so input files can be in different place to output
use function to reduce code duplication

replace GetFragmentDepth.pl with bedtools

More accurate & less custom code.
GetFragmentDepth.pl used read length to calculate fragment length which
meant it didn't match TLEN. It also duplicated some fragments when
start of read 1 == start(coordinate)/end(real) of read 2.

change input param to full file name not prefix

to work better with snakemake pipeline

add wrapper shell script

instead of claling EstimateConstants.R and
DeNovoPeakCalling-SingleBase.R with the same parameters
auto detect if files have already been calculated
loop over files instead of repeating code
separate likelihood function to avoid duplication of critical code

use random number seed & don't generate bedgraph

seed for reproducibility,
separate bedgraph creation for modularity

indicate software versions known to work

older versions *may* work, but haven't been tested
use tsv for tab sep formatted files
move perl scripts to main scripts folder

correct paths

datapath accidentally prefixed twice
enable setting of genomesize file by cmd line
enable number of autosomal chr to be set via cmd line

compute single bp coverage via bedgraph from single FragPos file

Previous commands took ~1 hour, bedtools would calculate ALL positions
in genome, even if FragPos file only contained one chr. This behaviour
changed in July 2015, see https://github.com/arq5x/bedtools2/issues/71
. New function takes <1min

split files into separate subfolders of "bychr"

too many files

read 5th cmd line argument

so it's possible to specify chr size file

include 0 in coverage bedgraph

so can be easily expanded to single base pair resolution

put Likelihood, Enrichment & Peaks in same bychr folder as other files

confusing to have two bychr folders in different directories

do bedtools coverage in serial

one file per inputfile, not necessary to create so many files
create tmp files inside datapath & use descriptive names

flip bedtools coverage parameters

"As of version 2.24.0, the coverage tool has changed such that the
coverage is computed for the A file, not the B file."
